item.title: Google blocked over 5 billion ads in 2024 amid rise in AI-powered scams
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Google blocked 5.1 billion ads and suspended more than 39.2 million advertiser accounts in 2024, according to its 2024 Ads Safety Report released this week. [...]

item.title: Apple fixes two zero-days exploited in targeted iPhone attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Apple released emergency security updates to patch two zero-day vulnerabilities that were used in an "extremely sophisticated attack" against specific targets' iPhones. [...]

item.title: Google begins unifying search country domains to Google.com
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google has announced that it's retiring separate country code top-level domain names like google.co.uk or google.com.br and redirecting users to Google.com. [...]

item.title: Jira Down: Atlassian users experiencing degraded performance
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Atlassian users are experiencing degraded performance amid an 'active incident' affecting multiple Jira products since morning hours today. Jira, Jira Service Management, Jira Work Management and Jira Product Discovery are among the impacted products. [...]

item.title: 41% of Attacks Bypass Defenses: Adversarial Exposure Validation Fixes That
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Picus Security
item.description: Your dashboards say you're secure—but 41% of threats still get through. Picus Security's Adversarial Exposure Validation uncovers what your stack is missing with continuous attack simulations and automated pentesting. [...]

item.title: CISA extends funding to ensure 'no lapse in critical CVE services'
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA says the U.S. government has extended MITRE's funding to ensure no continuity issues with the critical Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) program. [...]

item.title: Microsoft warns of blue screen crashes caused by April updates
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft warned customers this week that their systems might crash with a blue screen error caused by a secure kernel fatal error after installing Windows updates released since March. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Some devices offered Windows 11 upgrades despite Intune blocks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is working to fix an ongoing issue causing some users' Windows devices to be offered Windows 11 upgrades despite Intune policies preventing them. [...]

item.title: MITRE warns that funding for critical CVE program expires today
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: MITRE Vice President Yosry Barsoum has warned that U.S. government funding for the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) and Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) programs expires today, which could lead to widespread disruption across the global cybersecurity industry. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT 4.1 early benchmarks compared against Google Gemini
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT 4.1 is now rolling out, and it's a significant leap from GPT 4o, but it fails to beat the benchmark set by Google's most powerful model, Gemini. [...]

item.title: Midnight Blizzard deploys new GrapeLoader malware in embassy phishing
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russian state-sponsored espionage group Midnight Blizzard is behind a new spear-phishing campaign targeting diplomatic entities in Europe, including embassies. [...]

item.title: Landmark Admin data breach impact now reaches 1.6 million people
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Landmark Admin has issued an update to its investigation of a cyberattack it suffered in May 2024, increasing the number of impacted individuals to 1.6 million. [...]

item.title: Infamous message board 4chan taken down following major hack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: 4chan, a notorious online forum, was taken offline earlier today after what appears to be a significant hack and has since been loading intermittently. [...]
